h3.div: Central Decatur Emergency Food Program Meals LINK

div.p: Please click the link above or the upper right corner of the picture to the right to get full information.
Updates will be automatic when the document is updated.

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

div.p: New content will go live on Fridays, and provided in paper form on Mondays. Paper copies will be available from 11:30-12:30 during the meal distribution at North Elementary, and from 4-6p at North Elementary. They will also be sent with meals to our satellite locations each week.

div.span: April 17, 2020

h3.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-indent: 0;

div.jsaction: touchstart:UrsOsc; click:KjsqPd; focusout:QZoaZ; mouseover:y0pDld; mouseout:dq0hvd;fv1Rjc:jbFSOd;CrfLRd:SzACGe;

font-family: Lato; font-size: 20px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

div.span: Cardinal Community,

h3.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

div.jsaction: touchstart:UrsOsc; click:KjsqPd; focusout:QZoaZ; mouseover:y0pDld; mouseout:dq0hvd;fv1Rjc:jbFSOd;CrfLRd:SzACGe;
click:cOuCgd; mousedown:UX7yZ; mouseup:lbsD7e; mouseenter:tfO1Yc; mouseleave:JywGue; focus:AHmuwe; blur:O22p3e; contextmenu:mg9Pef;

span.style: top: -11px
font-family: Lato; font-size: 20px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

div.span: In her news conference today, Governor Reynolds announced that Iowa schools will not reopen for the remainder of the 2019-2020 school year due to the spread of the novel coronavirus (COVID-19). I want to be clear though, that while the Governors directive does not reopen schools, we are NOT done educating our students.

h3.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

div.jsaction: touchstart:UrsOsc; click:KjsqPd; focusout:QZoaZ; mouseover:y0pDld; mouseout:dq0hvd;fv1Rjc:jbFSOd;CrfLRd:SzACGe;
click:cOuCgd; mousedown:UX7yZ; mouseup:lbsD7e; mouseenter:tfO1Yc; mouseleave:JywGue; focus:AHmuwe; blur:O22p3e; contextmenu:mg9Pef;

span.style: top: -11px
font-family: Lato; font-size: 20px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

div.span: As a result, the Iowa Girls High School Athletic Union and the Iowa High School Athletic Association also cancelled all four boys and girls spring sports, including golf, soccer, tennis and track and field. The cancellation of the school year and sports seasons comes out of an abundance of caution for our students, staff and community in general.

h3.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

div.jsaction: touchstart:UrsOsc; click:KjsqPd; focusout:QZoaZ; mouseover:y0pDld; mouseout:dq0hvd;fv1Rjc:jbFSOd;CrfLRd:SzACGe;
click:cOuCgd; mousedown:UX7yZ; mouseup:lbsD7e; mouseenter:tfO1Yc; mouseleave:JywGue; focus:AHmuwe; blur:O22p3e; contextmenu:mg9Pef;

span.style: top: -11px
font-family: Lato; font-size: 20px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

div.span: Additionally, summer sports are suspended pending an assessment made in collaboration with state officials before June. Practice, competition and post season dates will be determined based on the current status of the coronavirus in Iowa and announced when they become available.

h3.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

div.jsaction: touchstart:UrsOsc; click:KjsqPd; focusout:QZoaZ; mouseover:y0pDld; mouseout:dq0hvd;fv1Rjc:jbFSOd;CrfLRd:SzACGe;
click:cOuCgd; mousedown:UX7yZ; mouseup:lbsD7e; mouseenter:tfO1Yc; mouseleave:JywGue; focus:AHmuwe; blur:O22p3e; contextmenu:mg9Pef;

span.style: top: -11px
font-family: Lato; font-size: 20px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

div.span: The Central Decatur Board of Education is scheduled to meet in session on Wednesday, April 22 to formally respond to the Governors directive. At this meeting, Board Directors will review Iowa Department of Education guidance that waives instructional time requirements for the remainder of this school year and consider implications for potential summer learning opportunities and students return to learn in August.

h3.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

div.jsaction: touchstart:UrsOsc; click:KjsqPd; focusout:QZoaZ; mouseover:y0pDld; mouseout:dq0hvd;fv1Rjc:jbFSOd;CrfLRd:SzACGe;
click:cOuCgd; mousedown:UX7yZ; mouseup:lbsD7e; mouseenter:tfO1Yc; mouseleave:JywGue; focus:AHmuwe; blur:O22p3e; contextmenu:mg9Pef;

span.style: top: -11px
font-family: Lato; font-size: 20px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

div.span: Central Decatur initiated voluntary educational enrichment opportunities for students in preschool-12th grade this week and will continue to provide learning lessons and activities for students for the remainder of the school year. The following data is a testament to the tremendous job Central Decatur staff have done in creating meaningful ways to engage in learning this week and how students have responded accordingly:

h3.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

div.jsaction: touchstart:UrsOsc; click:KjsqPd; focusout:QZoaZ; mouseover:y0pDld; mouseout:dq0hvd;fv1Rjc:jbFSOd;CrfLRd:SzACGe;

span.style: top: -11px
font-family: Lato; font-size: 20px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

div.span: 83 Google Classroom Meets were offered for preschool - senior students to attend

div.span: 42 hours of classroom connection were provided through Google Meets with students

h3.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;
margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

div.jsaction: touchstart:UrsOsc; click:KjsqPd; focusout:QZoaZ; mouseover:y0pDld; mouseout:dq0hvd;fv1Rjc:jbFSOd;CrfLRd:SzACGe;
click:cOuCgd; mousedown:UX7yZ; mouseup:lbsD7e; mouseenter:tfO1Yc; mouseleave:JywGue; focus:AHmuwe; blur:O22p3e; contextmenu:mg9Pef;

span.style: top: -11px
font-family: Lato; font-size: 20px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

div.span: Central Decatur students and staff will continue to come together as a school community for the remainder of this school year. Teachers will continue to meet virtually with students and new lessons and activities will be developed on a weekly basis. The schedule for these meetings can be accessed at

span.style: font-family: Lato; font-size: 20px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: underline; vertical-align: baseline;
font-family: Lato; font-size: 20px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

div.span: . Grade level and course activities can continue to be accessed at

span.style: font-family: Lato; font-size: 20px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: underline; vertical-align: baseline;
font-family: Lato; font-size: 20px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

h3.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

div.jsaction: touchstart:UrsOsc; click:KjsqPd; focusout:QZoaZ; mouseover:y0pDld; mouseout:dq0hvd;fv1Rjc:jbFSOd;CrfLRd:SzACGe;
click:cOuCgd; mousedown:UX7yZ; mouseup:lbsD7e; mouseenter:tfO1Yc; mouseleave:JywGue; focus:AHmuwe; blur:O22p3e; contextmenu:mg9Pef;

span.style: top: -11px
font-family: Lato; font-size: 20px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

div.span: We understand todays news creates an unsatisfying and unfortunate end to the 2019-2020 school year. The spring is filled with a variety of activities and events that are significant in the lives of our students and staff. We are actively working with the Board, our staff and students to develop plans that will bring a successful resolution to an unanticipated disruption. As an example, Seniors have been invited to a Google Meet next Tuesday, April 21 with Rudy Evertsen, Secondary Principal, and Zach Clark, Athletic/Activities Director, to discuss options and considerations for graduation.

h3.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

div.jsaction: touchstart:UrsOsc; click:KjsqPd; focusout:QZoaZ; mouseover:y0pDld; mouseout:dq0hvd;fv1Rjc:jbFSOd;CrfLRd:SzACGe;
click:cOuCgd; mousedown:UX7yZ; mouseup:lbsD7e; mouseenter:tfO1Yc; mouseleave:JywGue; focus:AHmuwe; blur:O22p3e; contextmenu:mg9Pef;

span.style: top: -11px
font-family: Lato; font-size: 20px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

div.span: Additionally, we are working to address logistical considerations, such as access to the building for student materials that were left in lockers and desks, as well as academic considerations, such as 3rd quarter and semester grades and a host of other details that are impacted by this most recent change in our structure.

h3.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

div.jsaction: touchstart:UrsOsc; click:KjsqPd; focusout:QZoaZ; mouseover:y0pDld; mouseout:dq0hvd;fv1Rjc:jbFSOd;CrfLRd:SzACGe;
click:cOuCgd; mousedown:UX7yZ; mouseup:lbsD7e; mouseenter:tfO1Yc; mouseleave:JywGue; focus:AHmuwe; blur:O22p3e; contextmenu:mg9Pef;

span.style: top: -11px
font-family: Lato; font-size: 20px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

div.span: As always, we will continue to monitor the guidance of Governor Kim Reynolds @

span.style: font-family: Lato; font-size: 20px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: underline; vertical-align: baseline;
font-family: Lato; font-size: 20px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

div.span: and @

span.style: font-family: Lato; font-size: 20px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: underline; vertical-align: baseline;
font-family: Lato; font-size: 20px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

div.span: and the Iowa Department of Public Health @

span.style: font-family: Lato; font-size: 20px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: underline; vertical-align: baseline;
font-family: Lato; font-size: 20px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

div.span: in order to ensure we are responsive in our work to keep our students and staff safe.

h3.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

div.jsaction: touchstart:UrsOsc; click:KjsqPd; focusout:QZoaZ; mouseover:y0pDld; mouseout:dq0hvd;fv1Rjc:jbFSOd;CrfLRd:SzACGe;
click:cOuCgd; mousedown:UX7yZ; mouseup:lbsD7e; mouseenter:tfO1Yc; mouseleave:JywGue; focus:AHmuwe; blur:O22p3e; contextmenu:mg9Pef;

span.style: top: -11px
font-family: Lato; font-size: 20px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

div.span: Tell your kids, our students, we miss them and to be well. We all look forward to a return to an even stronger Cardinal Community. Please dont hesitate to reach out to me if you have questions.

h3.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

div.jsaction: touchstart:UrsOsc; click:KjsqPd; focusout:QZoaZ; mouseover:y0pDld; mouseout:dq0hvd;fv1Rjc:jbFSOd;CrfLRd:SzACGe;

span.style: top: -11px
font-family: Lato; font-size: 20px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

div.span: Chris Coffelt,

div.span: CD Superintendent of Schools

span.style: top: -11px
font-family: Lato; font-size: 20px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

div.span: Cardinal Community,

h3.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

div.jsaction: touchstart:UrsOsc; click:KjsqPd; focusout:QZoaZ; mouseover:y0pDld; mouseout:dq0hvd;fv1Rjc:jbFSOd;CrfLRd:SzACGe;
click:cOuCgd; mousedown:UX7yZ; mouseup:lbsD7e; mouseenter:tfO1Yc; mouseleave:JywGue; focus:AHmuwe; blur:O22p3e; contextmenu:mg9Pef;

span.style: top: -11px
font-family: Lato; font-size: 20px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

div.span: As we reflect on the last 14 school days students have missed due to Governor Reynoldss emergency declaration, we are acutely aware that we have had to respond to challenges none of us have ever experienced - as individuals, in our families or in our school community. Despite our current circumstances, I am inspired by the efforts of our staff to make the best of the situation. Consider what has been accomplished for our students and families this last week alone:

div.span: Every teacher has developed an online Meet schedule that will be shared with students through their email. Staff have tried to schedule sessions at a variety of times. We know many families are sharing devices, limited internet bandwidth, and data plans. It is our hope that all students will connect each week with at least one teacher, however, we know this may not always be possible. If the day/time doesnt work for your child (i.e. due to work), please email your childs teacher. The Google Meets are voluntary and will be focused on connecting students and resources, maintaining student/school relationships, and answering homework questions. Directions and times for this new opportunity can be found at

One thing is for certain, however; we are all in this together and we will seek answers that make sense given these unprecedented times.

div.span: In addition to student learning, Central Decatur continues to focus on continuity of all services and will continue to provide a free grab and go meal service for any child 18 years of age and under on Monday, Tuesday and Thursday throughout the closure. This does include our satellite distribution sites. New student learning packets will be distributed during the lunch service on Monday, April 6. Our school food pantry will continue to host a weekly distribution. Any Central Decatur family can access this service as long as they have a student that attends our school system.

As Benjamin Franklin once said, Out of adversity comes opportunity. I look forward to the opportunities ahead of us as a school community, knowing that together we can.

div.span: While I anticipated we would have to react to the impact of COVID-19 when we returned from Spring Break, none of us understood how much or how quickly things would actually change.

h3.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

div.jsaction: touchstart:UrsOsc; click:KjsqPd; focusout:QZoaZ; mouseover:y0pDld; mouseout:dq0hvd;fv1Rjc:jbFSOd;CrfLRd:SzACGe;

span.style: top: -11px
font-family: Lato; font-size: 20px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

div.span: In response to Governor Reynolds recommendation to close all schools in Iowa through April 10th, the Central Decatur Board of Education met in a special session this morning, Thursday, March 19. Board Directors voted unanimously to temporarily close school for the next three weeks through April 10, in order to ensure students and staff are not unnecessarily exposed to or contribute to the spread of the Coronavirus.

h3.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: top: -11px
font-family: Lato; font-size: 20px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

div.span: In an expressed commitment to the staff that serve our students and school community on a daily basis, CD Board Directors also approved a Pandemic Pay Resolution, which provides pay for

span.style: font-family: Lato; font-size: 20px; font-style: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
font-family: Lato; font-size: 20px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

div.span: contracted staff (Classified, Certified and Coaches) during the temporary closure through April 10. Leadership begins at the top; the Board recognizes the critical role our staff fill at Central Decatur and has demonstrated their support in a meaningful manner during a challenging time.

div.span: has been developed to provide our parents and community members the opportunity to ask questions, provide suggestions or inform us of additional considerations in the coming days. Our goal is to respond to these questions within 24 hours and develop an ongoing FAQ sheet that will be posted on our web page for our entire school community. This questionnaire will remain open and can be accessed at any point throughout the closure.

div.span: Breakfast (7:45 am - 8:30 am) and lunch (11:30 am - 12:30 pm) meal service will be provided free of charge to all children birth through 18 years of age, beginning Monday, March 23. These will be served as a grab and go option so we do not violate the current recommendation for group sizes of no more than 10. Primary meal service will be provided at the high school. The District will also provide service to surrounding school district community sites including: Barnum Community Center; High Point Methodist Church parking lot; Davis City Community Center; Grand River Community Center; and, Van Wert Community Center. If you have not yet, please complete the

div.span: CD Staff have started to develop educational resources, activities and sites for students to stay engaged during this closure and as a measure to support families that is linked on our District COVID-19 page on the district website. Families will receive additional communication from their building level principal and teachers highlighting a variety of ways to stay connected and continue to learn.

div.span: Currently the IHSAA and IGHSAU have declared that sports are now in a prohibited period for practice, competition, and sanctioned activity until the closure is lifted. This prohibition means no in-person contact between coaches and student-athletes for the duration of the period. We will continue to monitor and assess the impact of this closure on our spring and summer sports programs and events.

div.span: South Elementary, North Elementary and the Middle/High School buildings are closed to staff and the public until further notice. This includes facility rentals, open gym, the weight deck and general use until further notice. We truly apologize for the inconvenience as we pride ourselves on serving as the center of the community.

div.span: Our custodial staff have implemented deep clean and disinfectant procedures in order to ensure a healthy learning environment for students when they return.

font-family: Lato; font-size: 20px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

div.span: I know these are trying times and there is a significant burden being placed on families given the impact that school closures have on our day-to-day lives. I also know that as Central Decatur community members and citizens of our state, nation, and world, we have an important responsibility to help mitigate the spread of COVID-19. I appreciate your understanding, support and partnership at this time.

div.span: Chris Coffelt

span.span: Community Questions About Central Decatur Community School's Response to the COVID-19 Situation

Central Decatur Community School District has made the decision to suspend all academic instruction and athletic/activity events through April 10 to ensure the safety of our students, staff, and community. We understand that in this time of uncertainty there are many questions. We are sending out this form with the intent of getting your questions and providing the answers to them.

font-family: Lato; font-size: 25px; font-style: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
span.strong: WHAT YOU CAN DO TO HELP

h2.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Lato; font-size: 15px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: Families and community members can help prevent the spread of ALL contagious viruses, including COVID-19, by following these steps:

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Lato; font-size: 15px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: If you are sick, stay home.

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Lato; font-size: 15px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Lato; font-size: 15px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: Cover your mouth with your upper arm or a tissue when coughing or sneezing.

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Lato; font-size: 15px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: Wash your hands often with soap and water for at least 20 seconds. Use an alcohol-based hand sanitizer that contains at least 60% alcohol if soap and water are not available.

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Lato; font-size: 15px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: Avoid touching your eyes, nose, and mouth with unwashed hands.

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Lato; font-size: 15px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: Avoid close contact with people who are sick.

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Lato; font-size: 15px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: Clean and disinfect frequently touched objects and surfaces.
